## 

. 



$$
T(n) = aT(n/b) + f(n)
$$

$n$. $T$. $a$$T$$n/b$$f(n)$.

## 

$f(n)$

$$
\begin{equation}
T(n) = aT(n/b) \tag{1}
\end{equation}
$$

**

** . $n$$n/b$$1$. $(1)$

$$
\displaystyle 
\begin{matrix} 
     & k \\\\
    T(n)= & \overbrace{a(a(a\cdots a(T(\frac{n}{b^k})\cdots)))} \\
\end{matrix}
$$

$k=\log_bn$$n/b^k=1$. $\displaystyle T(\frac{n}{b^k})$

$$
\displaystyle a^{\log_b n} = n^{\log_b a}
$$

*n*

$(1)$****$\displaystyle \log_b a$.

## 

**but at what cost?** $f(n)$.$f(n)$

[^1]

$\displaystyle f(n) = \Theta(n^{\log_b a} log^{\epsilon}n)$


{% notel yellow  %}
**case1**
$\epsilon >0$
$$\displaystyle f(n) = O(n^{\log_b (a) - \epsilon})$$

$$\displaystyle T(n) = \Theta(n^{\log_b a})$$
**case2**
$\epsilon \geq0$
$$\displaystyle f(n) = \Theta(n^{\log_b a} log^{\epsilon}n)$$

$$\displaystyle T(n) = \Theta(n^{\log_b a}log^{\epsilon+1}n)$$
**case3**
$\epsilon >0$
$$\displaystyle f(n) = \Omega(n^{\log_b (a) + \epsilon})$$
$c < 1$$n$
$$
af(n/b)<cf(n)
$$

$$\displaystyle T(n) = \Theta(f(n))$$
{% endnotel %}

> *.*

. 
$f(n)$****. $f(n)$$O(n^{\log_b a - \epsilon})$$f(n)$$\log_b a$$T(n)$$\displaystyle \Theta(n^{\log_b a})$. $f(n)$$O(n^{\log_b a + \epsilon})$$f(n)$$\log_b a$$T(n)$$f$$\Theta(f(n))$.

**$f$$\log_b a$** $n$$\log n$. .

{% notel green  %}

{% endnotel %}

## 



![](/images/hw1-master-thm.png)

**Problem 4 (a)**

{% notel blue  %}
$\displaystyle \log_2 4 = 2 > 1$. 
$$T(n) = \Theta(n^{\log_2 4}) = \Theta(n^2)$$ $\square$
{% endnotel %}

**Problem 4 (b)**

{% notel blue  %}
$log_4 2 = 1/2 = 1/2$. $\epsilon \geq 0$
$$\displaystyle \sqrt n = \Theta(n^{\log_2(4)} \log^{\epsilon}n)$$

 $$\displaystyle T(n) = \Theta(\sqrt n \log^{\epsilon+1}n)$$
 $\epsilon$
 $$\displaystyle T(n) = \Theta(\sqrt n \log n)$$
{% endnotel %}

**Problem 4 \(c\)**

{% notel blue  %}
$\displaystyle \log_4 3 < 1$. $\displaystyle \epsilon=\frac{1}{2}(1 - \log_4 3)$
 $$\displaystyle f(n) = \Omega(\displaystyle n^{\log_4 3 + \epsilon})$$
 $\Theta(n\lg n) = \Theta(n \log n)$
$$T(n) = \Theta(n \log n)$$$\square$
{% endnotel %}

**Problem 4 (d)**

{% notel blue  %}
$\log_2 9 \approx 3.17 > 3$. 
$$T(n)=\Theta(n^{log_2 9})$$$\square$
{% endnotel %}

## 

- $T(n) = aT(n / b) + f(n)$$n$$a$$n / b$$f(n)$
- 
- $f(n)$$\Theta(n^{\log b a})$

> **Ultimately, **

## 



$A, B \subset \Omega$. 


$$
A = B \Leftrightarrow I_{A} = I_{B}
$$

$$

$$

$$

$$

.

> [!thm]

> \begin{align} \\
> I_{A \cap B} &= I_{A}I_{B} \\
> I_{A \cup B} &= I_{A} + I_{B} - I_{A}I_{B} \\
> I_{A^C} &= 1- I_{A} \\
> I_{A\Delta B} &= |I_{A} - I_{B}|
> \end{align} 
> $$

. 

> [!example]
>

> \bigcup_{1}^nA_{j} = \sum_{1}^nI_{A_{j}} - \sum_{1\leq j_{1}\leq j_{2}\leq n} I_{A_{j_{1}}\cap A_{j_{2}}} + 
> $$



$$
 I_{\bigcup_{1}^nA_{j}} = \sum_{1}^nI_{A_{j}} - \sum_{1\leq j_{1}\leq j_{2}\leq n} I_{A_{j_{1}}\cap A_{j_{2}}} + \cdots + (-1)^{n - 1} I_{A_{1} \cap A_{2}\cdots A_{n}}
$$

1100. 0. 1$A_{j}$$m$$A_{j}$. 

$$
\binom{m}{1} - \binom{m}{2} + \cdots +(-1)^{m - 1} \binom{m}{m} = \binom{m}{0} - (1 - 1)^m = 1
$$

## Monotone Class Theorem(MCT)



> [!thm]
> $\mathcal A$
> 1. $m(\mathcal A) = \sigma (\mathcal A)$
> 2. $\mathcal B$m$\mathcal A \subset \mathcal B$$\sigma(\mathcal A) \subset \mathcal B$
> 

1. 

$\mathcal A \subset m(\mathcal A) \subset \sigma(\mathcal A)$. $\sigma$-m-m-. $\sigma(\mathcal A) \subset m(\mathcal A)$. $m(\mathcal A)$$\sigma$-. $m(\mathcal A)$. .

$m(\mathcal A)$$m(\mathcal A)$. 

$$
\begin{align}
C_{2  } &= \{ B: B \in m(\mathcal A) ,A\cap B \in m(\mathcal A) \text{ for all } A \in m(\mathcal A)\} &\text{  } \\
C_{3  } &=\{ A: A \in m(\mathcal A), A^c \in m(\mathcal A) \}  &\text{}
\end{align}
$$

$m(\mathcal A) \subset C_{2}$$m(\mathcal A) \subset C_{3}$. 

$$
C_{1} = \{  A: A\in m(\mathcal A),A \cap B \in m(\mathcal A) \text{ for all } B \in \mathcal A \}
$$

$m(\mathcal A)$. .

- $C_{1}$

$A_{n}$$A_n \cap B$$m(\mathcal A)$. 


$$
\begin{align}
\lim_{ n \to \infty } A_{n} \cap B = \bigcup_{k = 1}^\infty   (A_{n} \cap B)   = B \cap \left( \bigcup_{k = 1}^\infty A_{k} \right) 
\end{align}
$$



$$
B \cap \left( \bigcup_{k = 1}^\infty A_{k} \right) = \bigcup_{k = 1}^\infty (A_{k} \cap B) \in m(\mathcal A)
$$

$\bigcup_{k = 1}^\infty A_{k} \in C_{1}$ (by definition).

$A_{n}$

$$



$$

$$
$m(\mathcal A)$ De'Morgan .

$\mathcal A \subset C_{1}$

$A \in \mathcal A$$A\in m(\mathcal A)$$B \in \mathcal A$$A\cap B \in \mathcal A$$A\cap B\in m(\mathcal A)$$\mathcal A \subset C_{1}$
